student_achievements.summary: Garima Verma, a 3rd-year Applied Art student from the School of Fine Arts, achieved significant recognition on World Photography Day. Her photographs were selected for an International Virtual Photography Competition, with one earning first place in the Grassroots Innovations category. Additionally, "he" secured third prize in a painting competition focused on circular economy and sustainability during National Productivity Week, and received a Certificate of Excellence for a portrait of Nobel Laureate Amartya Sen in a Sweden India painting contest.
student_achievements.raw_content:
Garima Verma (3rd Year- Applied Art, School of Fine Arts) has received an award in the International Virtual Photography Competition on the occasion of World Photography Day- 19th August 2021. Her three photographs got selected in the competition; one of the photographs has received first position in the category of Grassroots innovations.
He secured third prize in the painting competition on the theme “Circular economy for Productivity & sustainability” on the occasion of National Productivity Week Celebration organized by national productivity Council, New Delhi.
He has been awarded the Certificate of Excellence for his winning painting of Nobel Laureate Amartya Sen in Sweden India Nobel Memorial Painting Contest organized by Embassy of Sweden.

faculty_profiles.summary: This document profiles several individuals involved in the arts and academia, highlighting their diverse expertise and contributions. Dr. Mani Nandini Sharma is recognized for her doctoral research on Paul Cézanne, teaching, and artistic exhibitions. Mr. Nitesh is noted for his engagement in performance art, traditional arts like dhokra metal casting, and participation in art events. Anjali Sharma specializes in printmaking and has exhibited her work widely. Mr. Saket is a multimedia professional skilled in video editing and graphic design. Naman Soni is a concept artist with experience in game development and animation. Dr. Vinay Patel is a visual arts scholar whose PhD focused on the representation of identity on Indian postage stamps. Ar. Khushboo is an academician and Head of Department of Design, with published research and teaching experience. Gouri Moharana applies her background in applied arts and cultural studies to research on traditional Odishan art, alongside graphic and textile design work. Lastly, Vidushi is an artist focusing on graphic and creative illustrations, with experience as a mentor and illustrator.
faculty_profiles.raw_content:
Dr. Mani Nandini Sharma
Mr. Saket Kumar Singh
Dr. Mani Nandini Sharma is an accomplished academician, artist, and has extensive experience in the field of Fine Arts. Doctoral degree earned in Fine Arts Post-Impressionist Paul Cezanne's work, has published significant studies on the inspiration and spirituality in his paintings, and taught a wide range of subjects including Composition, Modern Art History, Post-Impressionism and Art Appreciation. This blend of scholarly research, teaching excellence, and hands-on experience demonstrate Dr. Sharma’s expertise in art criticism and expressive visual vocabulary, has exhibited artworks widely across India and presented research at numerous conferences, demonstrating a commitment to advancing Fine Arts through academics, research, and artistic expression.
An avid participant and organizer in the art community, Mr. Nitesh active in various art talks and workshops across India and abroad is actively engaged in performance art, discussions on art and gender equality. Additionally, experience in traditional arts, such as dhokra metal casting, is recognized and awarded by Chandigarh Lalitkala. Has active participation in numerous prestigious exhibitions and art events- to name a few- American Centre in New Delhi, Bikaner House's Kalamkaar Art Gallery.
Anjali Sharma, is an academician and expertise in Print-Making. She holds a Master's degree in Printmaking from M.S University, Baroda. She has practicing art with variety of disciplines, such as Printmaking, Painting. Significant contributions to the field of art with her expertise in diverse techniques, including etching, aquatint, paper pulp, engraving, woodcut, and collagraphy. Anjali's work has been featured in numerous group exhibition and articles published in esteemed art magazines. Showcasing the talent, and dedicated commitment to Academics. The practices in art is an enrichment to the art community, inspiring both peers and young minds.
Professional in Multimedia Mr. Saket specializes in video editing, graphic design, logo creation, and branding. With experience spanning to multiple languages and diverse projects, including corporate work, news channels, documentaries, and music albums, brings a comprehensive skill set to every project. Equipped with latest software expertise in Video Editing Software, VFX Software, Fusion Studio. Expertise in Photoshop, Coral Draw, and Camera Handling of high configuration, photography and Direction. Mr. Saket’s expertise extends beyond traditional editing methods, ensuring a polished and professional outcome in Academics
As a seasoned Concept Artist, Naman Soni has earned diverse skill sets. Developed through various roles across multiple locations and industries Naman has experience in creating immersive and competitive game maps, designing environments for 2D animation projects, and developing compelling visual narratives. Experiences-at-hand of establishing consistent design and visual language, alongside illustrating environment concepts to visually develop the storyline, the aptly varied roles have equipped Naman with the ability to visualize and create engaging content across different media, contributing to the holistic understanding of visual storytelling and design.
Dr. Vinay Patel is a Visual Arts Scholar and Academician with extensive research experience, National and international Conferences, Workshops in his name, currently at Noida International University, completed PhD at Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi, in 2022, focusing on the "Representation of Identity and Cultural Politics on Postage Stamps in India (1947-2017)." awarded an M.Phil from the same institution, with research on Gandhi’s image on Indian currency and postage stamps. Dr. Vinay Patel earned professional degree in Applied Arts M.F.A. and B.F.A. from BHU; strength areas being Historical and Cultural Studies and Visual Communication Design; qualified National Eligibility Test (NET) in Visual Arts in 2023.
Ar. Khushboo an ardent professional with strong academic foundation has passion for research, dynamic in creating inclusive educational environment with industry experience and professional outlook. In academia: she has taught at Educational institutions of high repute, research articles and book chapters are published in Scopus indexed journals and has presented at various national and international conferences. Presently Head of the Department of Design and NAAC Coordinator, Ar. Khushboo has received accolades such as the Best Presentation Award at the National Conference on Legacy of Islamic Architecture 2022 and the Best Teacher Award 2023 at Noida International University.
Gouri Moharana with a versatile approach towards art and expression in Art has higher Education in Applied Arts and Cultural Studies, a solid academic foundation and passion for research in Indian traditional Art of Odisha, portraying an analytical eye on Patta painting and cow dung toys, Several publications and work presented at notable conferences. Portrays extensive professional experience as Graphic Designer, Textile Designer in multiple advertising agencies, co-operative societies, contributing her expertise to the next generation of professionals and artists. Extensive exhibitions, and participation in numerous art shows, including the IVth International Online Art Exhibition, Khajuraho Art Mart-2021, and Women's Day exhibitions, her work is featured in international and national exhibitions, reflecting her active engagement in the art community.
Vidushi is a prolific Artist with a strong interest in Graphic and Creative Illustrations. She has worked as a personality development mentor for aspiring MBA students.
She is a lead illustrator at a Small town Bandits, a Creative Consultancy in India from last 2 years.
She has worked as an Intern at Delhi Secretariat under Shri Manish Sisodia in Art, Culture and Linguistic department. Full time job at an Organisation called Expert GRAD as a Research Associate.
